sentences.text: Dear Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Urban Outfitters, Inc. to be held at 10:30 a.m., on Tuesday, May 23, 2017, at our corporate headquarters, 5000 South Broad Street, Building 543, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19112- 1495 (the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The matters to be considered and voted upon are described in the 2017 Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders and the Proxy Statement that accompany this letter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important that your shares be represented and voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kindly read the attached Proxy Statement and vote your shares over the Internet, by telephone or, if you received one, by signing and dating the paper copy of the proxy card and returning it promptly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to seeing you at the Annual Meeting where we will review the business and operations of Urban Outfitters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard A. Hayne Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DATE: April 3, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5000 South Broad Street
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19112-1495
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS May 23, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO OUR SHAREHOLDERS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Urban Outfitters, Inc. (the Company) will be held at our corporate headquarters, 5000 South Broad Street, Building 543, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19112-1495, on May 23, 2017 at 10:30 a.m., for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect nine directors to serve a term expiring at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To ratify the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for Fiscal Year 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To approve the Urban Outfitters 2017 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To hold an advisory vote to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To hold an advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes to approve executive compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company unanimously recommends that you vote FOR the election of each of the nominees for director listed in Proposal 1, FOR Proposals 2, 3 and 4 and that, with respect to Proposal 5, you vote for a frequency of 3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company has fixed March 17, 2017 as the record date for determining which shareholders are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting of Shareholders or any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Azeez Hayne Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DATE: April 3, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: URBAN OUTFITTERS, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5000 South Broad Street
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19112-1495
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Urban Outfitters, Inc. (the Company) is furnishing this proxy statement to solicit proxies from the Companys shareholders for use at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the Annual Meeting), to be held on Tuesday, May 23, 2017 at 10:30 a.m., at the Companys corporate headquarters, 5000 South Broad Street, Building 543, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19112- 1495, and any adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is making its proxy statement (this Proxy Statement) and its annual report to shareholders available electronically via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or before April 13, 2017, we will mail to our shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) containing instructions on how to access this Proxy Statement and our annual report and how to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who receive the Notice will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials in the mail, although a proxy card will be mailed separately to each shareholder that beneficially owns more than 1,000 of the Companys common shares, par value $.0001 per share (the Common Shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials, please follow the instructions included in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders of record, as shown on the transfer books of the Company at the close of business on March 17, 2017 (the Record Date), are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the Record Date, there were 116,290,358 Common Shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record on the Record Date may vote by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Internet by visiting the website specified in the Notice and on the proxy card,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) telephone using the instructions provided in the Notice and on the proxy card or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) marking, executing and returning the proxy card, in accordance with the instructions thereon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who hold their Common Shares in street name through a bank, broker or other holder of record (a nominee) must vote their Common Shares in the manner prescribed by their nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presence at the Annual Meeting in person or by proxy of the holders of a majority of the Common Shares entitled to vote is necessary to constitute a quorum, which is required for the Company to conduct business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Common Share entitles the holder to one vote on each matter presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting is properly authorized over the Internet or by telephone or proxy cards are properly dated, executed and returned, the Common Shares will be voted in accordance with the instructions of the shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder giving a proxy has the power to revoke it prior to its exercise either by giving written notice to the Secretary of the Company, by voting in person at the Annual Meeting, by executing a subsequent proxy card or by submitting a subsequent proxy over the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who hold their Common Shares in street name must obtain a legal proxy from their nominee in order to vote at the Annual Meeting and must otherwise follow instructions provided by their nominee with respect to revocation of voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the vote threshold required for approval of each proposal and the effect on the outcome of the vote of abstentions and uninstructed shares held by nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a shareholder who holds his or her Common Shares in street name does not provide voting instructions to his or her nominee, the nominee may not vote those shares on matters deemed non- routine (referred to as broker non-votes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 1, 3, 4 and 5 below are non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signed but unmarked proxy cards will be voted FOR the election of each of the nominees for director listed in Proposal 1, FOR Proposals 2, 3 and 4, for a frequency of 3 years with respect to Proposal 5 and in accordance with the judgment of the persons voting the proxies with respect to such other matters as may come before the Annual Meeting and any adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal Number Item Votes Required for Approval Effect of Abstentions Uninstructed Shares/Effect of Broker Non-votes 1 Election of directors Affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast (a Majority Vote) with respect to each nominee No effect Not voted/No effect 2 Ratification of the appointment of Deloitte & Touch LLP as the Companys independent public accounting firm for Fiscal Year 2018    Majority Vote No effect Discretionary vote by nominee 3 Approval of the Urban Outfitters 2017 Stock Incentive Plan    Majority Vote No effect Not voted/No effect 4 Advisory, non-binding vote to approve executive compensation Majority Vote No effect Not voted/No effect 5 Advisory, non-binding vote on the frequency of future advisory votes to approve executive compensation The frequency (every year, every two years or every three years) that receives the most votes cast by shareholders will be considered the frequency recommended by the shareholders No effect Not voted/No effect
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Amended and Restated By-laws the (By-laws) provide for the Board of Directors to be composed of as many directors as are designated from time to time by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, there are nine directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director elected shall serve for a term of one year and until a successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise directed, the persons named on the proxy intend to vote all valid proxies received by them FOR the election of the listed nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event any of the nominees shall be unable or unwilling to serve as a director, the persons named on the proxy intend to vote FOR the election of any person as may be nominated by the Board of Directors in substitution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has no reason to believe that any of the nominees named below will be unable or unwilling to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A nominee for election as a director must receive a majority of the votes cast to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the votes cast means that the number of the votes cast for a nominee must exceed the number of votes cast against that nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder is entitled to only one vote per share in the election of directors and each director nominee is voted upon separately.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an incumbent director who is a candidate for re-election is not elected, the director will be deemed to have tendered his or her resignation to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee of the Board of Directors (the Nominating Committee) will make a recommendation to the Board of Directors on whether to accept or reject the resignation, or whether other action should be taken, and the Board of Directors will be required to act on the Nominating Committees recommendation and disclose its decision and the rationale for the decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees for re-election to the Board of Directors to serve as directors are Edward N. Antoian, Scott A. Belair, Harry S. Cherken, Jr., Scott Galloway, Margaret A. Hayne, Richard A. Hayne, Elizabeth Ann Lambert, Joel S. Lawson III and Robert H. Strouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that seven of the nominees, Messrs. Edward N. Antoian, Scott A. Belair, Harry S. Cherken, Jr., Scott Galloway, Joel S. Lawson III, Robert H. Strouse, and Ms. Elizabeth Ann Lambert, are independent under the listing standards of the NASDAQ Global Select Market (NASDAQ).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that all of its directors possess personal and professional integrity, good judgment, a high level of ability and business acumen, and have performed exceptionally well in their respective time served as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2011
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDWARD N. ANTOIAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Antoian, 61, is a partner of and Chief Investment Officer for Zeke Capital Advisors, a financial advisory firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also employed by Chartwell Investment Partners, an investment advisory firm, where he has worked since its inception in 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Antoian is the General Partner of Zeke, L.P., a privately offered long-short equity hedge fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1984 until 1997, Mr. Antoian was the Senior Portfolio Manager of Delaware Management Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Mr. Antoian worked at E.F. Hutton in Institutional Sales and as a certified public accountant for Price Waterhouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Antoian holds an MBA in Finance and has financial and investment experience as a result of his experience as a CPA, financial advisor and portfolio manager.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Antoian also serves as a director of a not-for-profit entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an independent director, Mr. Antoian brings his in-depth understanding of, and expertise in, finance and accounting to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCOTT A. BELAIR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 1976
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Belair, 69, co-founded Urban Outfitters in 1970 and has not been an employee since 1971, prior to incorporation of the Company in 1976.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as Principal of The ZAC Group, a financial advisory firm, since 1989.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, he was a managing director of Drexel Burnham Lambert Incorporated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Belair is also an advisory director of M&T Bank (NYSE: MTB) (formerly Hudson City Bancorp, Inc. and Hudson City Savings Bank).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He holds an MBA degree and has financial and investment expertise, including financial reporting expertise, as a result of his significant experience as a CPA, financial advisor, and former chief financial officer in the financial services industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a co-founder of the Company, Mr. Belair has been involved with the Company from its inception and accordingly has a comprehensive understanding of and perspective on its overall business and strategic direction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HARRY S. CHERKEN, JR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 1989
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cherken, 67, has been a partner of the law firm of Drinker Biddle & Reath LLP in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania since 1984, is a former managing partner of that firm, and previously served as either Chair or Co-Chair of its Real Estate Group for 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a real estate lawyer with over 40 years experience representing public and private companies in the acquisition, construction, development, financing, leasing, management, consolidation, and disposition of commercial real estate, he has extensive experience with various
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: types of real estate transactions and retail leases, including negotiating real estate transactions and leases on behalf of the Company nearly from its inception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cherken also holds a Masters in Liberal Arts degree and serves as a trustee of various not-for-profit entities and academic institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCOTT GALLOWAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Galloway, 52, is a Clinical Professor of Marketing at NYU Stern School of Business, where he has taught since 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently teaches brand strategy and digital marketing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His teaching is rooted in years of experience as a marketing practitioner and entrepreneur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Galloways niche in the field is digital marketing, with his most influential contribution being the Digital IQ index, an assessment and ranking of luxury brands on the basis of mobile, social media, and digital marketing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010, he founded L2, a subscription business intelligence firm for luxury brands and serves as chairman of its board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Galloway is also the founder of several other firms, including RedEnvelope Inc. and Prophet Brand Strategy, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to those firms, Mr. Galloway managed outside financing rounds, grew revenues and played an integral role in each entitys ultimate sale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also holds an MBA degree.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Galloways years of experience as a marketing practitioner and entrepreneur lend valuable expertise to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARGARET A. HAYNE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2013
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hayne, 58, joined the Company in August 1982.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is a 41-year veteran of the retail and wholesale industry and has served as Chief Executive Officer of Free People since August 2016 and as Chief Creative Officer of Urban Outfitters, Inc. since November 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hayne previously served as President of Free People from March 2007 until August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard A. Hayne, the Companys current Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, is Ms. Haynes spouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an employee of the Company for over 30 years and a director since 2013, Ms. Hayne brings a wealth of both Company-specific and industry-wide knowledge and experience to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RICHARD A. HAYNE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 1976
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hayne, 69, co-founded Urban Outfitters in 1970.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been Chairman of the Board of Directors since the Companys incorporation in 1976 and, until February 2016, also served as the Companys President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hayne served as the Companys principal executive officer until 2007 and again beginning in January 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Margaret A. Hayne, Chief Executive Officer of Free People and Chief Creative Officer of Urban Outfitters, Inc., is Mr. Haynes spouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Haynes long tenure leading the Company as Chairman of the Board of Directors, his tenure as principal executive officer, and his exceptional leadership skills make him uniquely qualified to serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIZABETH ANN LAMBERT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2014
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Lambert, 53, is the founder and a partner of Bunkhouse Group, LLC, a hospitality management company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2006, Ms. Lamber formed Bunkhouse Group, LLC to oversee a growing portfolio of eclectic hotels and coffee shops.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bunkhouse currently operates the Hotel San Jos, the Hotel Saint Cecilia, three Jos Coffee shops, the Hotel Havana and El Cosmico, an 18-acre vintage trailer, tepee tent hotel and event space.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to her experience as a hotelier, Ms. Lambert worked as a prosecutor in the New York County Distric Attorneys office and the Austin, Texas Attorney Generals office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Ms. Lambert also serves on the Board of Directors of the National Council on Crime & Delinquency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Lamberts experience growing a design-centric and customer-focused hospitality company from the ground up gives her a unique perspective and set of skills to contribute to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JOEL S. LAWSON III
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 1985
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lawson, 69, is an independent consultant and private investor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From November 2001 until November 2003, he also served as Executive Director of M&A International Inc., a global organization of merger and acquisition advisory firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1980 until November 2001, Mr. Lawson was Chief Executive Officer of Howard, Lawson & Co., an investment banking and corporate finance firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Howard, Lawson & Co. became an indirect, wholly-owned subsidiary of FleetBoston Financial Corporation in March 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the former Chief Executive Officer of an investment banking and corporate finance firm, Mr. Lawson has extensive experience in financial and investment matters, including financial reporting expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as the former Executive Director of a global organization of merger and acquisition advisory firms, he has specialized knowledge regarding mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also holds an MBA degree and serves as a director of various not-for-profit entities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROBERT H. STROUSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2002
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Strouse, 68, serves as President of Wind River Holdings, L.P. (Wind River), which oversees a diversified group of privately owned industrial and service businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Strouse joined Wind River in 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through his experience with this private investment company, Mr. Strouse brings to the Board of Directors experience in strategic planning, budgeting, talent recruitment and development, risk management and corporate development activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Wind River, Mr. Strouse was a corporate lawyer whose practice focused on mergers and acquisitions, corporate governance and SEC reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Strouse also serves as a director of a number of privately owned companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE ELECTION OF EACH OF THE NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AT URBAN OUTFITTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business is managed under the direction of our Board of Directors in accordance with the Pennsylvania Business Corporation Law of 1988 and our By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Board of Directors are kept informed of our business through discussions with the Chairman of the Board of Directors (the Chairman), the Chief Financial Officer and other officers, by reviewing materials provided to them and by participating in regular and special meetings of the Board of Directors and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, to promote open discussion among our non-employee directors, those directors meet in regularly scheduled executive sessions without the participation of management or employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has a long-standing commitment to sound and effective corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foundation for our corporate governance is the Board of Directors policy that a majority of the members of the Board of Directors should be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have reviewed internally and with our Board of Directors the provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the related rules of the SEC and current NASDAQ Marketplace Rules regarding corporate governance policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance documents comply with all applicable requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our By-laws, our Board of Directors has specified that, as of the date of our Annual Meeting, the number of directors will be nine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seven of our directors are non-employee directors and the Board of Directors has determined that each of the seven non-employee directors has no relationship that, in the opinion of the Board of Directors, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director, and that each meets the objective requirement of independence under the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board of Directors has determined that each of these seven directors is, and would be, an independent director under the standards currently set forth in the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither Richard A. Hayne nor Margaret A. Hayne is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Audit Committee below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors currently combines the role of Chairman and the role of Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard A. Hayne currently serves in both of these positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes this is the most efficient and effective leadership structure for the Company at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hayne is the co-founder of the Company and has been its Chairman since the Companys incorporation in 1976, and as such, the Board of Directors believes that he is uniquely qualified through his experience and expertise to set the agenda for, and lead discussions of, strategic issues for the Company at the board level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hayne has been instrumental in the Companys historical success and is in large part responsible for the Companys substantial growth since its inception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the Companys corporate governance structure provides the appropriate balance between the need for consistent strategic direction and the need for objectivity and independence of the non-management directors and includes several effective oversight mechanisms, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Board of Directors is comprised of a majority of independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) following most meetings of the Board of Directors, the independent directors meet in executive session without the Chairman present to review, among other things, his performance as Chief Executive Officer; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) various committees of the Board of Directors composed of only independent directors perform oversight functions independent of management, such as overseeing the integrity of the Companys financial statements, senior executive compensation (including the compensation of the Chairman) and the selection and evaluation of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board of Directors believes that requiring that the Chairman be a non- management director would weaken the Companys leadership structure without providing any added benefit beyond that already achieved by its existing governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors retains authority to modify this structure as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to enhance the Board of Directors active and objective oversight of our management, the Board of Directors designated one of its independent directors to serve in a lead capacity (Lead Director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the independent directors selected Robert H. Strouse to serve as the Lead Director, and he continues to act in that role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The duties of the Lead Director are to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman is not present, including any executive sessions of the independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) call meetings of the independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) serve as the principal liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) approve the frequency of meetings of the Board of Directors and meeting agendas and schedules,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) be available, when appropriate and when the Chairman is not available, for consultation and direct communication with shareholders of the Company, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) review the Lead Director Charter on an annual basis and recommend to the Board of Directors for approval any modifications or changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the charter for the Lead Director is available on the Companys corporate website, www.urbn.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal 2017, the Board of Directors held four meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Board of Directors attended at least 75% of the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors and all committees on which he or she sits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All references in this Proxy Statement to our fiscal years refer to the fiscal years ended on January 31 in those years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Fiscal 2017 refers to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companys fiscal year ended January 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has an Audit Committee, a Compensation and Leadership Development Committee (Compensation Committee), a Nominating and Governance Committee and an Innovation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charters of these committees have been approved by our Board of Directors and are available on the Companys corporate website at www.urbn.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter that has been approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed annually by the Audit Committee with any recommended changes approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees primary responsibility is to assist the Board of Directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities to our shareholders and other constituencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of those oversight responsibilities, the Audit Committees primary duties are to: (1) appoint (and terminate), compensate and oversee the work of the independent accountants, including the audit plan, scope and procedures; (2) pre- approve, in accordance with its pre-approval policies, all audit services and permissible non-audit services provided by the independent accountants to the Company; (3) confirm and assure the independence of the independent accountants by reviewing and discussing the formal written statement and other periodic written reports received from the independent accountants regarding their objectivity and independence, including statements concerning other relationships and services that may affect their independence; (4) set clear hiring policies for employees and former employees of the independent accountants; (5) consider and review with the independent accountants, management of the Companys internal audit department and management the adequacy and effectiveness of the Companys internal controls, including processes for identifying significant risks or exposures (as further discussed in Risk Management below) and elicit recommendations for the improvement of such internal control procedures where desirable; (6) review with the independent accountants and management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Companys financial reporting (including financial statements and related footnotes),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any significant changes required in the independent accountants audit plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any material difficulties or disputes with management encountered during the course of the audit,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) other matters related to the conduct of the audit,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) any material written communications provided by the independent accountants to management and the Companys response to those communications and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) any legal and regulatory matters that may have a material impact on the financial statements; (7) review the appointment, replacement, reassignment or dismissal of management of the Companys internal audit function; (8) review and approve all related-party transactions; (9) establish procedures for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal accounting controls, or auditing matters and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the confidential, anonymous submission by employees of the Company of concerns regarding these issues; (10) report committee actions to the Board of Directors with such recommendations as the Audit Committee may deem appropriate; (11) prepare the audit committee report required to be filed with the SEC; (12) investigate any matter brought to its attention within the scope of the Audit Committees duties, with the power to retain and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: determine the appropriate compensation for independent legal, accounting, financial and other advisors as the Audit Committee may deem necessary or appropriate to carry out its duties, at the expense of the Company; and (13) enforce the Companys Code of Conduct and Ethics (the Code of Conduct).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has been established in accordance with Section 3(a)(58)(A) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Audit Committee is independent under the independence standards discussed above, and that each member meets the additional independence standards applicable under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and related rules of the SEC and NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors has determined that each of the current directors serving on the Audit Committee, Joel S. Lawson III, Edward N. Antoian and Scott A. Belair, qualifies as an audit committee financial expert in accordance with the definition set forth in Item 407(d)(5)(ii) of Regulation S-K, as adopted by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee operates under a written charter that has been approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed annually by the Compensation Committee with any recommended changes approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for overseeing our compensation strategy and for the oversight and administration of our compensation programs including our stock incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee: (1) annually reviews and determines the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer and all other executive officers, including the use of cash incentives and deferred compensation plans; (2) determines the Companys policy with respect to the application of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue of 1986, as amended (the Code); (3) approves compensation programs and grants involving the use of the Common Shares and other equity securities; (4) appoints (based on the consideration of certain factors set forth in the Compensation Committee charter), compensates and oversees the work of the compensation consultant retained by the committee; (5) prepares an annual report on executive compensation for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement in accordance with applicable rules and regulations; and (6) reviews and discusses with management plans and programs to support the selection, development and retention of future leadership for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Compensation Committee is independent under the independence standards currently set forth in the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of the role of executive officers and compensation consultants in determining executive and director compensation, see Compensation of Executive Officers Compensation Discussion and AnalysisDesign of Compensation Program and Operation and ProcessRole of Executive Officers in Establishing Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee operates under a written charter that has been approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed annually by the Nominating Committee with any recommended changes approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee, in consultation with our Chairman: (1) recommends to the Board of Directors for its selection
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) potential nominees for director to stand for election at the Companys annual meeting of shareholders, including without limitation, those proposed by shareholders and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) individuals to be considered by the Board of Directors to fill vacancies; (2) establishes criteria for selecting new directors; (3) conducts, or causes to be conducted, background and qualifications checks of new director candidates; and (4) evaluates directors before nomination for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also periodically reviews the Companys corporate governance policies and practices and recommends to the Board of Directors any appropriate modifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Nominating Committee is independent under the independence standards currently set forth in the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Innovation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Innovation Committee operates under a written charter that has been approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed annually by the Innovation Committee with any recommended changes approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Innovation Committee assists the Board of Directors in its oversight on matters of innovation and disruptive technologies (e.g., technologies that create new markets and disrupt existing markets).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Innovation Committee: (1) reviews and discusses the Companys strategic approach to disruptive technologies and commercial innovation, including objectives, strategic initiatives and investments; (2) reviews and discusses disruptive technology issues and trends, and the impact those trends might have on the Company; and (3) reviews how the Company measures and determines whether or not its disruptive technologies and innovation strategy are succeeding, including its execution and customer acceptance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee recommends director nominees to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee seeks individuals with diverse experience from traditional corporate environments as well as from other sources who are qualified to be directors based on the Nominating Committees judgment of the potential candidates experience, skills and knowledge of business and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: management practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If needed, the Nominating Committee will use a third-party search firm to assist in finding director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company engaged a consultant to assist in identifying and evaluating potential director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee considers the diversity of directors as part of the overall mix of factors when identifying and evaluating candidates for the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company considers diversity broadly to include differences of viewpoint, professional experience, individual characteristics, qualities and skills, resulting in naturally varying perspectives among the directors and individual skills that complement the full Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee strives to broaden the knowledge and viewpoints of the members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board of Directors, as a unit, possesses the appropriate skills and experience to oversee the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As currently constituted, the Board of Directors consists of directors with several different areas of expertise and different perspectives; for example, it includes a director who is a co-founder of the Company with financial advisory expertise, the head of a private investment company, a founder of a hospitality management company, an entrepreneur and professor of marketing, a private investor with a background in international mergers and acquisitions and investment banking, a lawyer specializing in real estate with an emphasis on retail leasing, the Chief Executive Officer of one of the Companys brands and the Companys Chief Creative Officer and the Companys current Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, who is also a co-founder of the Company with broad experience in the Companys business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will give appropriate consideration to qualified persons recommended by shareholders for nomination as directors and will evaluate such qualified persons in the same manner as other identified candidates, when submitted prior to the applicable shareholder proposal date referred to in the Proposals for 2018 Annual Meeting section of this Proxy Statement, provided such recommendations comply with the applicable procedures in the Companys By-laws, which are summarized in that section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may submit director recommendations in writing to the Nominating Committee at Urban Outfitters, Inc., 5000 South Broad Street, Philadelphia, PA 19112-1495.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such recommendations must also include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) sufficient biographical information about the proposed nominee to permit the Nominating Committee to evaluate his or her qualifications and experience and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the nominees consent to being named in the proxy statement and to serving as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is actively involved in the oversight of risks that could affect the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight is conducted primarily through the Audit Committee, but the full Board of Directors has retained responsibility for general oversight of risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, pursuant to its charter, considers and reviews with the Companys internal audit department, independent registered public accounting firm, and management the adequacy of the Companys internal controls, including the processes for identifying significant risks or exposures, and elicits recommendations for the improvements of such procedures where desirable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Audit Committees role, the full Board of Directors is involved in oversight and administration of risk and risk management practices by overseeing members of senior management in their risk management capacities, regularly reviewing and analyzing the Companys investment portfolio and accompanying risk levels and reviewing and analyzing inventory risk each quarter as part of the review of quarterly financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Companys senior management have day-to-day responsibility for risk management and establishing risk management practices, and members of management are expected to report matters relating specifically to the Audit Committee directly thereto and to report all other matters directly to the Board of Directors as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Companys senior management have an open line of communication to the Board of Directors and have the discretion to raise issues from time-to-time in any manner they deem appropriate, and managements reporting on issues relating to risk management typically occurs through direct communication with directors or committee members as matters requiring attention typically arise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee considers the risks that may be implicated with executive compensation, as discussed in Compensation of Executive OfficersCompensation Discussion and AnalysisDetermination of Amount of Element; Relation of Elements to Primary Compensation ObjectivesSetting Performance Criteria and Targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications with Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may communicate with members of the Companys Board of Directors by writing, as applicable, to the full Board of Directors, a particular committee or a specific director at Urban Outfitters, Inc., 5000 South Broad Street, Philadelphia, PA 19112- 1495.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys telephone number is (215) 454-5500 and its fax number is (215) 454-4660.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Companys policy, the directors are expected to attend the Companys annual meetings of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys current directors attended last years annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has had a written code of conduct for a number of years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct applies to the Companys directors and employees, including our Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Principal Accounting Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct includes guidelines relating to compliance with laws, the ethical handling of actual or potential conflicts of interest, the use of corporate opportunities, the protection and use of the Companys confidential information, the acceptance of gifts and business courtesies, compliance with anti-bribery and illegal payment laws, accurate financial reporting, and procedures for promoting compliance with, and reporting violations of, the Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct is available on the Companys corporate website at www.urbn.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company intends to post any amendments to the Code of Conduct and also to disclose any waivers (to the extent applicable to the Companys executive officers and directors) on its website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPROVAL OF THE URBAN OUTFITTERS 2017 STOCK INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, you will be asked to approve the Urban Outfitters 2017 Stock Incentive Plan (the 2017 Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors approved the 2017 Plan on December 12, 2016, subject to shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan is being submitted for your approval in accordance with NASDAQ Marketplace Rules, to qualify certain awards as performance-based awards under Section 162(m) of the Code, and to obtain favorable federal income tax treatment for incentive stock options under Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the Urban Outfitters 2008 Stock Incentive Plan (the 2008 Plan), certain awards may not be granted after February 25, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board of Directors believes that the 2017 Plan is necessary so that the Company may continue to attract, retain and motivate employees, non-employee directors and consultants through the grant of options, stock appreciation rights, stock, restricted stock and restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan is attached as Appendix A to this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following description of the 2017 Plan is intended merely as a summary of its principal features and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the provisions of the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common Shares Available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has reserved 10,000,000 Common Shares for issuance under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No more than 4,000,000 Common Shares are available for restricted stock grants and awards of restricted stock units under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No more than 1,000,000 Common Shares are available for stock grants under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During any fiscal year, no employee may be granted options covering more than 2,000,000 Common Shares, stock appreciation rights covering more than 2,000,000 Common Shares, or restricted stock and restricted stock units covering more than 2,000,000 Common Shares (in the aggregate).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the above limits is subject to adjustment for certain changes in the Companys capitalization such as stock dividends, stock splits, combinations or similar events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an award expires, terminates, is forfeited or is settled in cash rather than in Common Shares, the Common Shares not issued under that award will again become available for grant under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Common Shares are surrendered to the Company or withheld to pay any exercise price or tax withholding requirements, only the number of Common Shares issued, net of the shares withheld or surrendered, will be counted against the number of Common Shares available under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards have been granted under the 2017 Plan, and as a result, no benefits or amounts that would have been received or allocated under the 2017 Plan are determinable at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, benefits or amounts which would have been granted for Fiscal 2017 if the 2017 Plan had been in effect are also not determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The closing price of the Common Shares on March 28, 2017 was $23.35.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two committees have authority to administer the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first committee, of which the Chairman of the Board is the sole member, administers the 2017 Plan for awards that relate to 40,000 or fewer Common Shares and are made to individuals not subject to Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act, and who are not covered employees for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee administers the 2017 Plan for all other awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These committees are referred to collectively as the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator has considerable discretion in setting the terms of awards granted to employees, consultants, and non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Types of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2017 Plan, the Administrator may award incentive stock options, non-qualified stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock (including performance stock), restricted stock units (including performance stock units) and stock grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees and consultants of the Company and its subsidiaries and non-employee directors of the Company are eligible to receive awards under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors and consultants are not eligible to receive incentive stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator selects the employees, non-employee directors and consultants who will receive options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock awards, restricted stock units and stock grants under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Companys approximately 24,000 employees and its seven non-employee directors are currently eligible to receive awards under the 2017 Plan, as well as a limited number of consultants, not currently determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive officers and directors have an interest in approval of the 2017 Plan because it relates to the issuance of equity awards for which executive officers and directors may be eligible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may award incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive stock options offer employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: certain tax advantages that are not available for non-qualified stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator determines the terms of the options, including the number of Common Shares subject to the option, the exercise price and when the option becomes exercisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: option term of incentive stock options may not exceed ten years, and the per share exercise price of options may not be less than the fair market value of a Common Share on the date the option is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an employee, non-employee director or consultant terminates service with the Company, his or her option may expire before the end of the otherwise applicable option term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if an employee, non-employee director or consultant terminates his or her service with the Company for a reason other than death or disability, his or her options generally remain exercisable for up to 30 days after termination of service, unless the award agreement provides otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the employee, non-employee director or consultant terminates his or her service with the Company due to disability, his or her options generally remain exercisable for up to six months after termination of service, unless the award agreement provides otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the employee, non-employee director or consultant terminates service with the Company due to death, or dies following his or her termination of service but prior to the expiration of the option, his or her options generally remain exercisable for up to six months after the date of the grantees death unless the award agreement provides otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee, non-employee director or consultant may pay the exercise price of an option in cash or, if permitted by the Administrator, its equivalent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may also permit an optionee to pay the exercise price by surrendering previously acquired Common Shares, by decreasing the number of Common Shares for which the option is exercisable, through a so-called broker-financed transaction or in any combination of such methods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may permit or require an employee to pay any tax withholding obligation with Common Shares issuable upon the exercise of the non-qualified stock option or previously acquired shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may award stock appreciation rights to employees, non-employee directors and consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stock appreciation right entitles the grantee to receive an amount equal to the excess of the fair market value of the Common Shares on the date of exercise over the fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator determines when the stock appreciation right becomes exercisable and whether the appreciation will be paid in cash, Common Shares, or a combination of cash and Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an employee, non-employee director or consultant terminates service, dies or becomes disabled, his or her stock appreciation rights may expire before the end of the otherwise applicable stock appreciation right term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The period during which the stock appreciation right may be exercised is the same as the period for options, discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may make restricted stock awards to employees, non-employee directors and consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A restricted stock award is an award of Common Shares that is subject to certain restrictions during a specified period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator determines the length of the restriction period and the conditions, such as an employees continued employment with the Company or the achievement of certain performance goals, which must be met for the restrictions to lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company holds the Common Shares during the restriction period, and the grantee cannot transfer the shares before termination of that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grantee is, however, generally entitled to vote the Common Shares and receive any cash dividends declared and paid on the Companys Common Shares during the restriction period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For performance stock awards, the restrictions lapse only to the extent performance goals established by the Compensation Committee are met or the Compensation Committee waives the performance goal in the case of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of a termination of service, the Compensation Committee may provide that the restrictions lapse with respect to a pro-rata portion of the number of shares that would have lapsed if the grantee had been employed on the last day of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may select one or more performance criteria for each performance stock award from the following list: sales, profit, return on sales, net operating profit after taxes, investment turnover, customer service indices, funds from operations, income from operations, return on assets, return on net assets, asset turnover, return on equity, return on capital, market price of Common Shares, economic value added, total shareholder return, net income, pre-tax income, earnings per share, operating profit margin, net income margin, sales margin, cash flow, market share, inventory turnover, sales growth, net revenue growth, capacity utilization, new stores opened, customer penetration, increase in customer base, net income growth, expense control and hiring of personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The criteria may be applied to the individual, a division, a component of the Companys business, the Company and or one or more related corporations of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may award restricted stock units to employees, non-employee directors and consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each restricted stock unit represents the right to receive one Common Share or cash equal to the fair market value of a Common Share, when the restricted
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock unit vests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A bookkeeping account is established for each recipient of a restricted stock unit award that shows the number of restricted stock units granted, as well as full and fractional restricted stock units representing any cash dividends prior to the date the restricted stock unit vests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator determines the conditions, such as continued service with the Company or the achievement of certain performance goals that must be met for restricted stock units to vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance stock units vest only to the extent performance goals established by the Compensation Committee are met or the Compensation Committee waives the performance goal in the case of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of a termination of service, the Compensation Committee may provide for the pro-rata vesting of performance stock units that would have vested if the grantee had been employed on the last day of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may select one or more performance criteria for each award of performance stock units from the above list for performance stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Grants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may make stock grants to employees, non-employee directors and consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock grants are fully vested when made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Miscellaneous
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transferability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards generally are not transferable, except by will or under the laws of descent and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non- employee directors may transfer non-qualified stock options and stock appreciation rights to certain permitted transferees for no consideration, however, and the Administrator has the authority to permit similar transfers with respect to other non-qualified stock options and stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grantees right to receive or retain an award or any amount received thereunder, or to retain any profit or gain realized in connection with an award, is subject to any clawback policy adopted by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceleration of Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may, in its discretion, accelerate the date on which options and stock appreciation rights may be exercised, and may accelerate the date of termination of the restrictions applicable to restricted stock (other than performance stock) and restricted stock units (other than performance stock units), if it determines that to do so would be in the best interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control of the Company (as defined in the 2017 Plan), all outstanding options and stock appreciation rights become exercisable, and all outstanding restricted stock (including performance stock) and restricted stock units (including performance stock units) become vested, unless the applicable award agreement provides otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Capitalization/Certain Corporate Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is a change in the Companys capitalization that affects its outstanding Common Shares, the aggregate number and type of Common Shares subject to awards, together with the option exercise price, will be adjusted by the Administrator, as described in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan also provides that, in the event of a merger, consolidation or other specified corporate transaction, outstanding awards will be assumed by the surviving or successor corporation, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan also authorizes the Administrator to terminate the awards granted to employees, non-employee directors and consultants in the event of such a corporate transaction, after giving advance notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan became effective on December 12, 2016, subject to shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the requisite shareholder approval is not obtained by December 11, 2017, the 2017 Plan and all awards granted under the 2017 Plan will be null and void.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment/Termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may amend outstanding awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may amend or suspend the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder approval, however, is required for any material amendment (as defined under applicable NASDAQ Marketplace Rules) to the 2017 Plan, as well as for certain other amendments, such as an increase in the number of Common Shares authorized for issuance of incentive stock options and a change in the class of employees who may receive incentive stock options under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requisite shareholder approval is also required for any amendment that would require shareholder approval under Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may terminate the 2017 Plan at any time and for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No incentive stock options may be granted under the 2017 Plan after December 11, 2026.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax ConsequencesOptions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has been advised that the federal income tax consequences of granting and exercising options under the 2017 Plan are as follows (based on federal tax laws and regulations, as of January 1, 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of an option does not result in federal income tax consequences for the optionee or a deduction for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an option is exercised, the federal income tax consequences depend on whether the option is an incentive stock option or a non-qualified stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An optionee exercising a non-qualified stock option will recognize ordinary income equal to the difference between the fair market value of the stock exercised (on the date of exercise) and the option price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee will not recognize taxable income as a result of acquiring stock by exercising an incentive stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The difference between the fair market value of the exercised stock on the date of exercise and the exercise price will, however, generally be treated as an item of adjustment for purposes of alternative minimum taxable income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the employee holds the stock he receives on exercise of an incentive stock option for a required period of time, the employee will have capital gain (or loss) when the stock is later disposed of.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the employee does not hold the stock for the required period of time, the employee will generally have ordinary income when the stock is disposed of.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an optionee recognizes ordinary income on the exercise of a non-qualified stock option or the sale of stock acquired on exercise of an incentive stock option, the Company is generally entitled to a deduction in the same amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the 2017 Plan has been designed so that the amount of compensation that may be deducted with respect to options will not be limited by Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to file with the SEC a Registration Statement on Form S-8 to register the Common Shares available for issuance under the 2017 Plan after receiving shareholder approval of the 2017 Plan and prior to the issuance of any shares pursuant to the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are seeking a non-binding advisory vote from our shareholders to approve the compensation of our named executive officers, as set forth in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is intended to provide an overall assessment of our executive compensation program rather than focus on any specific item of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on an advisory vote at our 2011 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, subject to the results of an advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation to be held at this Annual Meeting, it is our current policy to hold an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing our shareholders with the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on the frequency of this advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers in Proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Companys 2014 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, our shareholders overwhelmingly approved, with approximately 98% of the votes cast, the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company welcomes our shareholders views on this subject, and our Board of Directors and Compensation Committee will carefully consider the outcome of this vote consistent with the best interests of all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, however, the outcome is not binding on the Company, the Board of Directors or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail under the heading Compensation of Executive OfficersCompensation Discussion and Analysis, the Companys executive compensation program is designed to attract, retain, and motivate executive and key employee talent in support of its primary objective of building compelling brands that connect with the customer on an emotional level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis for additional details about our executive compensation programs, including information about the Fiscal 2017 compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, we are seeking a vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and related narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE RESOLUTION ABOVE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are seeking a non-binding advisory vote from our shareholders to approve the frequency of the advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders can indicate their preference on whether we should hold an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers annually, every two years or every hree years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders also have the option to abstain from voting on this matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, our shareholders voted (on an advisory, non-binding basis) in favor of holding advisory votes to approve the compensation of our named executive officers every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon consideration of these results, as well as the Companys long- term goals, the structure of the Companys executive compensation program and the time necessary to implement and evaluate effective changes in compensation structure, the Board of Directors adopted this approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to believe that an advisory vote on executive compensation every three years would be most appropriate, as this will allow adequate time between votes for the Company to engage with shareholders to understand and respond to the results of this advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While this vote is advisory in nature and therefore will not bind us to adopt any particular frequency, our Board of Directors intends to carefully consider the voting results in determining how frequently we will hold future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE TO CONDUCT FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION EVERY THREE YEARS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
