sentences.text: COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation program is designed to attract, retain and motivate executive and key employee talent in support of its primary objective of building compelling brands that connect with the customer on an emotional level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that delivering value to the customer by excelling at experiential retailing is the foundation for the long-term maximization of shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design of Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of our primary objective, our compensation program is designed to motivate executives to maximize shareholder value and grow our brands, both in the short-term and the long-term, by rewarding executives for doing so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program seeks to establish balanced performance metrics that promote disciplined progress towards longer-term goals and that correlate to the revenue and profit objectives of, and appropriate risk to, the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of our executive officers total compensation is comprised of a combination of performance-based compensation and equity-based awards, which derive their benefit from increases in shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This furthers our core compensation principle of providing pay for both individual and Company-wide performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These long-standing compensation policies were designed and approved by management, the Compensation Committee and/or the Board of Directors, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, at the 2014 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, our shareholders overwhelmingly approved our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have identified the first step in attaining these objectives as having superior executives in place, and as such, our compensation programs initial purpose is to attract and retain exceptional executive leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This requires our compensation to be competitive in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other step in attaining our objectives is to reward these executives through annual performance-based compensation based on the achievement of specific operating goals that have been determined by the Compensation Committee based on recommendations by our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, through equity-based compensation, we attempt to align the compensation of our executives with the interests of the shareholders and motivate our executives to achieve the Companys longer-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Versus Currently Paid Out Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current compensation paid to executive officers includes base salaries, which are paid periodically throughout the fiscal year, and performance bonuses, which are awarded at the end of the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys long-term compensation has been comprised of stock options, stock appreciation rights, performance stock units and restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has long believed that the characteristics of equity-based compensation, particularly the extended vesting periods, leverage and the deferral of taxation until exercise or vesting, are closely aligned with maximizing shareholder value, supporting its long-term growth strategies, and aligning compensation with risk outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that equity-based compensation awards made in Fiscal 2015, Fiscal 2016 and Fiscal 2017 share these characteristics and offer the potential for meaningful compensation for superior performance measured over an extended period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning February 1, 2013, the Company allowed certain employees, including the Companys named executive officers, an opportunity to participate in the Urban Outfitters Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Plan (the Deferred Compensation Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plan is discussed more fully below in Equity-Based IncentivesNonqualified Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a matter of practice and philosophy, the Company has significantly limited the scope and value of perquisites provided to executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation structure attempts to balance the ongoing cash requirements of the named executive officers for current income with the Companys desire to create long-term incentives that are directly tied to growth in shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no pre-determined allocation between current and long-term compensation; the Compensation Committee maintains flexibility in this regard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, however, equity compensation has provided the majority of income that named executives have derived from their employment with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recognition of this, the Compensation Committee takes the performance of the Common Shares (and therefore the perceived value of them to the executive) into consideration when making compensation decisions for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different positions may yield a different balance between cash and equity compensation in light of what the Compensation Committee decides will best further the Companys objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in Fiscal 2017, the bonus potential for brand leaders may
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: equal or exceed their base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This reflects the Companys emphasis on the specific brand-related performance goals tied to the bonus for these particular executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Financial Officers maximum bonus potential in Fiscal 2017 was 100% of his base salary, a lower overall potential than brand leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Financial Officers bonus plan consists of financial metrics related to the revenue and profitability of the Anthropologie, Free People, and Urban Outfitters brands, representing 50% of his maximum
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: potential bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The different elements of compensation are discussed more fully below in Determination of Amount of Element; Relation of Elements to Primary Compensation Objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the beginning of Fiscal 2009, citing his ownership of a substantial number of Common Shares and his confidence in the Companys future performance, our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Richard A. Hayne, requested that his base salary be set at $1.00 per year, and the Compensation Committee continues to honor his request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hayne remained eligible to receive a performance bonus in Fiscal 2017, which was tied to revenue and profitability metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance criteria were based on two incremental levels (i.e. Plan level and Goal level).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Anthropologie and Free People Brands did not meet Plan or Goal levels for revenue or profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Urban Outfitters Brand met both Plan and Goal levels, and therefore Mr. Hayne received a bonus of $333,333 (against a maximum potential of $1,000,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose to focus on brand financial performance instead of Company-wide performance in order to create appropriate incentives for Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee provided Plan and Goal levels as the most appropriate measurements in Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operation and Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Compensation Committee, acting pursuant to its charter, sets the amount of each element of compensation for each named executive officer, as described herein and under Corporate Governance at Urban OutfittersCompensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally holds meetings at least four times a year, and compensation amounts for executive officers for the new fiscal year are generally set in the Companys first fiscal quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, there were four meetings of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is comprised of three members, Edward N. Antoian (who is the committees chairman), Joel S. Lawson III and Robert H. Strouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members are independent directors, as defined by the NASDAQ Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee charter is available on the Companys corporate website at www.urbn.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed by the Compensation Committee on an annual basis and revised as warranted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee directly engages PwC LLP as a compensation consultant to provide advice on executive compensation matters, and it performed such duties in Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors have discretion to appoint and terminate the consultant, as described in the Compensation Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines the scope of the consultants review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the compensation consultant did not make specific recommendations on the amount or form of compensation for any individual executive; however, the guidance and recommendations of the consultant regarding compensation generally have continued to inform the Compensation Committees decisions regarding overall compensation structures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwC LLP sends its invoices for the compensation consultants services directly to the Compensation Committee, which reviews the invoices and then forwards them to the Company for payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant billed the Company $1,500 for services rendered in Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal 2017, the Company also retained PwC LLP to provide services unrelated to executive compensation, including tax-related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate fees paid for those other services in Fiscal 2017 were $1,993,205.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management neither recommended nor made the decision to engage the compensation consultant; and neither the Compensation Committee nor the Board of Directors specifically approved the other services performed by PwC LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PwC LLP consultant who advises the Compensation Committee does not provide any other services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has evaluated the independence of PwC LLP and concluded that no conflict of interest exists that would prevent PwC LLP from independently advising the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Executive Officers in Establishing Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is solely responsible for compensation determinations and compensation policies applicable to executive officers, as well as other matters provided in the Compensation Committee charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Companys Chief Executive Officer nor any other executive officer makes any such determinations or sets any such policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does consult with the Chief Executive Officer in determining compensation levels for each other named executive officer, and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee takes his assessment of the performance of such executive officers into consideration when weighing the factors and setting compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer, General Counsel, Chief Financial Officer, President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group and Chief Operating Officer may attend portions of certain meetings of the Compensation Committee as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Chief Executive Officer nor any other officer has the authority to call Compensation Committee meetings or set meeting agendas themselves nor do they meet with the compensation consultant on an individual basis without the consent of the Compensation Committee or its chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer has the primary role in making recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding the assessment and design of programs, plans and awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is assisted by the President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group, Chief Operating Officer, General Counsel and Chief Financial Officer, who provide him with information and input on these items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elements of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation program is comprised of three main elements: (1) base salary, (2) performance bonus and (3) equity-based incentives, including stock appreciation rights, performance stock units, restricted stock units and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has evaluated the Companys overall compensation policies and practices for its employees to determine whether such policies and practices create incentives that can affect the Companys risk and management of that risk and has further assessed whether any risks arising from these policies and practices are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the evaluation, the Board of Directors considered, among other factors, the distribution of risk among the Companys brands and segments, the overall mixture of compensation elements used to incentivize employees and the Companys use of balanced performance metrics that promote disciplined progress towards longer-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its evaluation, the Board of Directors has concluded that the risks arising from the Companys policies and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selection of Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has chosen to utilize base salary, performance bonus and equity-based incentives because it believes such a compensation package, taken as a whole, is both competitive in the marketplace and directly reflects the Companys primary objective of maximizing shareholder value and growing its brands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rationale for the selection of each particular element is discussed in detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Amount of Element; Relation of Elements to Primary Compensation Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the amounts payable to each executive under each individual element of compensation, as well as the aggregate amount of compensation to such executive, in making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary is determined by position, experience and competitive market factors for comparable talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Inasmuch as the main objective of the compensation plan is maximizing shareholder value, the Company generally seeks to set base salaries at or near prevailing market rates for comparable levels of responsibility in specialty retail so as to reduce the levels of committed compensation expense on the Companys financial statements as well as the cash cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that it needs to offer competitive base salaries in order to retain and attract superior personnel, which is a key step in achieving its primary objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Bonuses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive officers are eligible to receive cash incentive bonuses based on the achievement of specific performance targets established in advance under the Urban Outfitters Executive Incentive Plan (as amended, the Incentive Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining performance objectives, the Compensation Committee sets forth specific targets that are consistent with its primary objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this presents the executive with clear objectives that, if achieved, will maximize shareholder value and further the growth of our brands while providing commensurate rewards to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines executive officer eligibility for performance bonuses during the Companys first fiscal quarter based on the Companys financial budgets and operating plans and the roles that the executives have in achieving those
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting Performance Criteria and Targets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets the performance criteria for each participant during the Companys first fiscal quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The criteria may be based on the performance of the participant, a division, the Company as a whole or a subsidiary of the Company, at the Compensation Committees discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance criteria may include, depending on the particular participant: sales, profit, return on sales, net operating profit after taxes, investment turnover, customer service indices, funds from operations, income from operations, return on assets, return on net assets, asset turnover, return on equity, return on capital, market price of Common Shares, economic value added, total shareholder return, net income, pre-tax income, earnings per share, operating profit margin, net income margin, sales margin, cash flow, market share, inventory turnover, sales growth, net revenue growth, capacity utilization, new stores opened, customer penetration, increase in customer base, net income growth, expense control and hiring of personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines performance criteria that are appropriate for each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also take into account the opinion of the named executive officer as to which criteria he or she feels is the best indicator of his or her performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a reasonable evaluation, the Compensation Committee concluded that while the criteria or targets for Fiscal 2017 reward prudent risk-taking in support of the Companys objectives, they do not encourage or promote inappropriate risk-taking by the participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee determines specific performance criteria for executive officers in light of the Companys growth strategy, major initiatives and current and projected operations and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of the above criteria may be used for the Chief Executive Officer, brand leaders or other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, the primary criteria for the performance bonus plans for executives with merchant responsibilities, such as the President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group, would be revenue and operating profits for their specific brands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executive officers who do not have merchant responsibilities, such as the Chief Financial Officer, the criteria generally include one or more brand or Company revenue and operating profits goals and may include specific targets related to their functional areas or other goals determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose to focus on brand financial performance instead of Company-wide performance in order to create appropriate incentives for Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee provided Plan and Goal levels as the most appropriate measurements in Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each performance criterion is then assigned a performance target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, for a criterion of number of new stores opened, the target would be the Companys goal for a specified number of stores opened, consistent with the operating budget and with the brand growth strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes historical revenue and operating profit performance and the current business environment into account in the development of the performance targets upon which performance bonuses are based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a criterion of revenue and operating profit, the performance target for Fiscal 2017 was based on the Companys achieving or exceeding two levels of revenue and operating profit, defined as Plan and Goal for the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The thresholds for the functional area objectives take into consideration the operating budget and the goal of leveraging selling, general and administrative expenses as top line revenue grows, and those for functional area performance ratings are driven by the brand leaders or the Chief Executive Officers assessments of the functional areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Compensation Committee establishes a schedule or matrix for each participant showing the maximum performance bonus (expressed as a percentage of base salary) payable for the achievement of the specified performance target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific amounts for each performance target are determined by assessing the profit contribution attained by meeting various targets, and measuring the compensation outcomes achieved by meeting those targets while taking into account total compensation from base salary, bonus and equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance targets and the percentage of performance bonus subject to each performance objective for the Companys named executive officers in Fiscal 2017 are described below in Measuring Achievement: Payment of Bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Executive Officers in Determining Performance Factors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the performance bonus factors of all named executive officers, the Chief Executive Officer, President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer make recommendations to the Compensation Committee, which it considers when setting the performance bonus plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Measuring Achievement: Payment of Bonuses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the fiscal year, the Compensation Committee determines the extent of achievement of the pre-established performance targets for each criterion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The level of achievement attained is applied to the schedule to determine the individuals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adjusted performance bonus percentage, which is then multiplied by the individuals award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the discretion to award that amount or adjust the award payable if it believes such action would be in the best interest of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to covered employees as defined under Section 162(m) of the Code (Covered Employees), however, such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adjustments may only be made to lower the compensation that would otherwise be receivable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for our Chief Financial Officer, all of our named executive officers during Fiscal 2017 were Covered Employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth in the table below are the performance targets and the percentage of performance bonus subject to each performance objective for Fiscal 2017 for the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Financial Officer, the President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group, the Chief Executive Officer, Urban Outfitters Group and the Chief Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Fiscal 2017, either a portion or all of each executive officers bonus (including those for named executive officers) was tied to one or two incremental levels of Brand revenue and operating profit measures: Plan and Goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Urban Outfitters Brand met its Plan for revenue of $1.41 billion, its Goal for revenue of $1.43 billion, its Plan for operating profit of $120.5 million and its Goal for operating profit of $123.5 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual Urban Outfitters Brand revenue was $1.43 billion and operating profit was $131.8 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, bonuses tied to the Urban Outfitters Brand performance criteria were paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Anthropologie Brand did not meet its Plan for revenue of $1.46 billion, its Goal for revenue of $1.48 billion, its Plan for operating profit of $190.5 million or its Goal for operating profit of $195.3 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual Anthropologie Brand revenue was $1.44 billion and operating profit was $159.2 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, bonuses tied to the Anthropologie Brand performance criteria were not paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Free People Brand did not meet its Plan for revenue of $676.7 million, its Goal for revenue of $683.5 million, its Plan for operating profit of $104.5 million or its Goal for operating profit of $107.1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual Free People Brand revenue was $662.3 million and operating profit was $88.1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, bonuses tied to the Free People Brand performance criteria were not paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company did not modify any performance targets during Fiscal 2017 to reflect changes in the financial budgets or goals upon which the performance targets and awards were based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company were to change such financial budgets in the future, however, the Compensation Committee would have discretion to adjust bonus awards accordingly where it believes it is warranted in light of the objectives of the compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Covered Employees, however, such adjustments may only be made to lower the compensation that would otherwise be receivable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-Based Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that stock ownership by management and equity-based performance compensation arrangements are useful tools to align the interests of management with those of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where executives are shareholders themselves, the executives will realize a direct benefit by maximizing shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as shareholders, executives will benefit from successful growth of the Companys brands to the extent that this will increase the value of their shareholdings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Companys executives are eligible to receive stock appreciation rights, performance stock units, restricted stock units, restricted stock and stock options under the Companys stock incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may grant awards under the 2008 Plan, previously approved by the Companys shareholders, and the 2017 Plan, which has been submitted to the Companys shareholders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, there are awards outstanding under the Urban Outfitters 2004 Stock Incentive Plan, although awards may no longer be made under such plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines whether to grant equity awards, the type of award and the size of the grant to each executive officer based upon its overall assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates the executive officers performance after taking into consideration prior years grants, the organizational impact of the executive officer and the need to respond to competitive conditions in order retain executive officers and attract new candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company did not grant stock appreciation rights to any executive officers because the Compensation Committee chose to utilize other forms of equity awards, such as performance stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the Compensation Committee believes that including stock appreciation rights in the compensation program serves the Companys longer-term goals in the same manner as other equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whereas base salary and performance bonuses compensate for achievement of shorter- term goals, equity awards motivate the executive to focus on the Companys long-term success because the value of the award generally cannot be realized for an extended period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that stock appreciation rights, which provide value to our executives only if the Companys share price increases relative to the share price on the date the awards are granted, generally share these beneficial characteristics and fit into the Companys overall compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Stock Units and Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance stock unit awards and restricted stock unit awards are additional forms of equity-based incentives available to the Compensation Committee under the Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock unit awards are purely time-vesting awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, under Design of Compensation ProgramLong-Term Versus Currently Paid Out Compensation, the Company believes that the performance stock unit awards made in Fiscal 2017 offer the potential for meaningful compensation for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: superior performance measured over an extended period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting is both time-based and performance-based; the awards will not vest until the date specified in the award agreement and, consistent with our core principle of providing pay for performance, are forfeited if the established performance criteria are not achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the performance stock unit awards granted in Fiscal 2017 to be an integral component of the named executive officers overall compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company made five grants of performance-based restricted stock units to named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 23, 2016, the Company granted 40,000 performance-based restricted stock units to Francis J. Conforti, Chief Financial Officer, 30,000 performance-based restricted stock units to Trish Donnelly, Chief Executive Officer, Urban Outfitters Group, and 50,000 performance-based restricted stock units to Calvin B. Hollinger, Chief Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fifty percent of each grant is subject to a performance period ending on February 23, 2018 where the average operating profit margin for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for fiscal years 2017 and 2018 is equal to or greater than 3.50% and the remaining fifty percent of the grant is subject to a performance period ending on February 23, 2019 where the average operating profit margin for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for fiscal years 2017, 2018, and 2019 is equal to or greater than 3.50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 23, 2016, the Company granted 100,000 performance-based restricted stock units to David W. McCreight, President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One hundred percent of this grant was subject to a performance period that ended on August 23, 2016, where direct-to-consumer sales for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the first and second quarters of fiscal 2017 were at least 5.00% greater than direct-to-consumer sales for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the first and second quarters of fiscal 2016 and the average operating profit margin for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the first and second quarters of fiscal year 2017 was equal to or greater than 3.50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance conditions for this grant were satisfied on August 23, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCreight is required to hold the Common Shares received pursuant to this grant for a period of six months following the vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 23, 2016, the Company granted 100,000 performance-based restricted stock units to David W. McCreight, President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One hundred percent of this grant was subject to a performance period that ended on February 23, 2017, where direct-to-consumer sales for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the third and fourth quarters of fiscal 2017 were at least 5.00% greater than direct-to-consumer sales for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the third and fourth quarters of fiscal 2016 and the average operating profit margin for Urban Outfitters, Inc. for the third and fourth quarters of fiscal year 2017 was equal to or greater than 3.50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance conditions for this grant were satisfied on February 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCreight is required to hold the Common Shares received pursuant to this grant for a period of six months following the vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company did not grant restricted stock awards to any executive officers because the Compensation Committee chose to utilize other forms of equity awards, such as performance stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock awards are one of several equity-based incentives available to the Compensation Committee under the Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that restricted stock awards generally share the same beneficial characteristics of stock options, but add a more significant retention element, and fit into the Companys overall compensation philosophy in the same manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company did not grant stock options to any executive officers because the Compensation Committee chose to utilize other forms of equity awards, such as performance-based restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the Compensation Committee believes that including stock options in the compensation program serves the Companys longer-term goals in the same manner as other equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options is equal to or greater than fair market value of the Common Shares on the date of the grant, as defined in the Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted pursuant to the Plans may be subject to performance-based vesting conditions, but to date, the Compensation Committee has granted only time-based stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company generally considers once-a-year grants to a broad group of executives and managers, including named executive officers, typically at regularly scheduled board meetings and at such other times as necessary for business purposes related to employee promotion, or retention, or new hires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company makes grants that are effective on or after the date when the Administrator (defined in the Plans as the Compensation Committee, or, for grants under a specified threshold made to certain
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employees, a committee of which the Chairman is the sole member) approves the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not time grants with respect to the release of positive or negative material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains an unfunded Deferred Compensation Plan primarily for the purpose of providing deferred compensation to a select group of employees who are limited in their participation under the Companys 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Deferred Compensation Plan is exempt from Sections 201(2), 301(a)(3) and 401(a)(1) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, and complies with the requirements of Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the Deferred Compensation Plan were adopted by the Board of Directors on November 27, 2012, and the Deferred Compensation Plan became effective on February 1, 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred compensation under the Deferred Compensation Plan consists of elective deferrals, if any, made by the participant and discretionary contribution credits made by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elective deferral credits will be fully vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary contribution credits may be subject to a vesting schedule determined by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment obligations, if any, under the Deferred Compensation Plan are payable in cash on a date or dates selected by the participant or upon certain specified events such as termination of employment, death or disability, subject to change in certain specified circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Types of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the three main elements, the Company provides additional compensation to its executive officers in the form of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a 401(k) matching contribution which is available to all employees who have completed three months of service, which is $0.25 on every $1.00 of employee deferral up to 6% of salary match, with a vesting schedule of 20% a year for five years, with the deferral limited by applicable law;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a holiday bonus, capped at $5,000; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) employee awards made to all staff with fixed dollar amounts, plus the tax cost of such awards, for terms of service, in five-year service increments, ranging from $1,000 for 10 years of service to $15,000 for 30 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its discretion, the Compensation Committee may also award bonuses to employees, including named executive officers, for individual achievement or outstanding performance, to motivate for achievement of specific Company or individual goals and/or to promote retention and loyalty to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company did not grant any discretionary bonuses in Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments Upon Changes in Control; Certain Corporate Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plans provide that in the event of a change in control of the Company, all remaining unvested options and restricted stock awards will immediately vest and become exercisable, as applicable, although with respect to awards granted under the 2008 Plan and the 2017 Plan, the applicable grant instrument may provide otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in control is defined to include an event in which any person or group acquires majority beneficial ownership of the Company, other than Richard A. Hayne or benefit plans sponsored by either the Company or its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding whether to exclude the change in control provisions in the grants, the Compensation Committee considers various factors, such as consistency with previous Company plans, industry practice, competition in the marketplace and effects on retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, grants to key executives made under the Plans included a provision that vesting would not accelerate upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of certain corporate transactions (such as a merger, consolidation, acquisition of property or stock, separation, reorganization, or liquidation), the Compensation Committee has discretion to terminate all or a portion of outstanding options and stock appreciation rights, effective as of the closing of the corporate transaction, if it determines that such termination is in the best interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Compensation Committee decides to terminate, the holder will have the right to exercise outstanding options and stock appreciation rights on at least seven days notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these corporate transactions as a triggering event for potential termination because they believe they are customary in industry practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2014, PwC LLP, the Companys compensation consultant, reviewed publicly available information regarding the compensation paid to chief executive officers, chief financial officers, chief operating officers and division presidents of specialty retailers similar in operations and revenue to the Company (generally not less than 35% or more than 200% of the Companys annual revenue) and made a presentation to the Compensation Committee regarding this analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retailers reviewed were Abercrombie & Fitch, Aeropostale, American Eagle Outfitters, Ann Inc., Chicos FAS, Coach, Express, Fossil Inc., Genesco, Guess, Lululemon Athletica Inc., Polo Ralph Lauren and Quiksilver.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed the figures provided by the consultant, which provided the groups median and the 25th and 75th percentiles for informational and overall comparison purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee considered the comparative data provided, there is no target percentile or precise position in which the Compensation Committee aims to set compensation other than to generally be competitive in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to executives other than the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, President, URBN and Chief Executive Officer, Anthropologie Group, and Chief Executive Officer, Urban Outfitters Group, neither PwC LLP nor the Compensation Committee has undertaken any formal benchmarking over the last three fiscal years; however, in prior years of reviewing base salaries to determine whether the Company is meeting its goal of providing competitive compensation that will attract and retain outstanding personnel, the Compensation Committee from time to time has reviewed publicly available compensation information described in the periodic filings of an informal group of other publicly traded companies in the specialty retail industry, typically including the retailers reviewed by the Companys compensation consultant, for purposes of a market reference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Compensation Committee elects to analyze comparative data, there may be a variation in the companies reviewed for comparative purposes from year-to-year depending on what information becomes most relevant to the Compensation Committee, although the Compensation Committee anticipates referring to information available for publicly traded specialty retailers, including those reviewed in Fiscal 2014, for the foreseeable future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes the Companys own historical data into consideration to ensure that compensation increases are consistent with the growth in operating profit and in responsibility of its executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee reviews a summary of all of the Companys named executive officer and key management personnel compensation for the previous fiscal year as well as prior fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All historical data is viewed with the operating results and responsibilities of management personnel and their specific performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Discretion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors related to increasing the compensation and potential compensation from bonuses of named executive officers from year-to-year takes into account increased revenue and profitability, performance and measurably increased responsibilities, with a focus on both performance and the leveraging of selling, general and administrative expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not generally decreased base salaries or the bonus potential of named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is because its history of growth has led to larger responsibilities for its named executive officers and because as a matter of philosophy, it does not generally reduce these compensation elements for existing employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As more fully described above, however, at Mr. Haynes request, the Compensation Committee set his base salary at $1.00 in Fiscal 2009, which has remained in effect since that time and will continue in effect for Fiscal 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committee has discretion in the granting of performance bonus awards and can grant such awards to executive officers who are not Covered Employees at its discretion, even if specified performance goals are not achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The requirements for performance bonus awards were not waived in Fiscal 2017, but could be waived in the future to reward specific performance achievements in an instance where the actual criteria for a performance bonus were not met or for purposes of retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may reduce any executive officers award if it believes such action would be in the best interest of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of a fiscal year, the Compensation Committee also has the ability to grant cash bonuses to any executive officer on a discretionary basis, as described above in Additional Types of Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Plans, the Compensation Committee has discretion to accelerate the date on which options or stock appreciation rights may be exercised and may accelerate the date of termination of the restrictions applicable to restricted stock and restricted stock units if it determines that to do either would be in the best interests of the Company and the plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company at present has no employment agreements or contracts with its named executive officers and has no policies for post-termination compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, however, the Company may, in its sole discretion, decide to provide some form of severance in the event that a named executive officers employment ceases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The applicability of Section 162(m) of the Code, may affect the tax deductibility of certain portions of named executive officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wherever possible, the Company structures compensation for its executive officers in a way that preserves tax deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not usually consider the tax consequences to named executive officers of cash compensation or of equity- based compensation, though it considers the tax treatment to the Company for non-qualified options and the non-qualifying disposition of qualified options to be favorable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Security Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has no policy that requires or sets guidelines for the ownership of Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct was amended in July 2016 to prohibit executive officers (as well as directors and certain other employees) from engaging in certain hedging or monetization transactions related to the Companys Common Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Advisory Shareholder Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the annual meeting of shareholders on May 27, 2014, our shareholders overwhelmingly approved, on a non-binding advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys executive officers, including the Companys compensation practices and principles and their implementation, as discussed and disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables, and the narrative executive compensation disclosure contained in our 2014 Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee appreciates and values the views of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Compensation Committee evaluated the Companys compensation practices throughout Fiscal 2017, the Compensation Committee was mindful of the strong support our shareholders expressed by the 2014 shareholder advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this strong level of support of the overall pay practices, and of the general effectiveness of our long-standing compensation policies, the Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee do not currently intend to make any material changes to our executive compensation program for Fiscal 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future advisory votes on executive compensation, including the advisory vote that will be held at the Annual Meeting, will serve as an additional tool to assist the Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee in evaluating the alignment of the Companys executive compensation program with the interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the annual meeting of shareholders on May 17, 2011, our shareholders expressed a preference that advisory votes on executive compensation occur every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the results of this vote, the Board of Directors determined to implement an advisory vote on executive compensation every three years until the next required vote on the frequency of shareholder votes on the compensation of executives, which is scheduled to occur at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard A. Hayne, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman, and Margaret A. Hayne, Chief Executive Officer of the Free People Brand and Chief Creative Officer of Urban Outfitters, Inc., are married.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Haynes son, David A. Hayne, whose total compensation in Fiscal 2017 was $644,233, is employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total compensation amounts in this paragraph include salary, bonus, equity awards and 401(k) Company contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Harry S. Cherken, Jr., a director of the Company, is a partner of the law firm of Drinker Biddle & Reath LLP, which provided legal services to the Company in Fiscal 2017 and is expected to continue to do so in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drinker Biddle & Reath LLP has received customary compensation for these services in a net amount of $2,419,967 during Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The McDevitt Company, a real estate company, acted as a broker in substantially all of the Companys new real estate transactions during Fiscal 2017 in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not paid any compensation to The McDevitt Company, but the Company has been advised that The McDevitt Company has received commissions from other parties to such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wade L. McDevitt is the brother-in-law of Scott Belair, one of the Companys directors, and is the president and sole shareholder of The McDevitt Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McDevitts wife, Wendy McDevitt, is an employee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. McDevitt owns McDevitt Corporation Limited, a United Kingdom entity, and McDevitt Netherlands BV, a Dutch entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Fiscal 2017, the Company paid real estate commissions of $156,824 to West Street Consultancy Limited, a United Kingdom entity owned by an employee of McDevitt Corporation Limited, and $144,297 to McDevitt Netherlands BV.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has been advised that West Street Consultancy Limited has entered into an arrangement to share a portion of its commissions with McDevitt Corporation Limited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On September 20, 2016, the Company, through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Anthropologie, Inc., entered into a Ground Lease (the Lease) with Waterloo Devon, L.P. (the Landlord).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wade L. McDevitt is a minority owner of the Landlord and its general partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Lease, the Company rented approximately 6 acres located in Devon, Pennsylvania to develop a lifestyle center, which will include a large format Anthropologie, a Terrain store, several URBN restaurant concepts, and a boutique event space.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commencement of the Lease is contingent on obtaining certain zoning, land use and land development approvals within specified timeframes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If those contingencies are met, the Lease has an initial term of 40 years with two options to extend, each for an additional ten-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The initial rental rate is $1.1 million per year and rent increases 10% every five years during the initial term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of rental payments payable under the initial term of the Lease is approximately $62.1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Real estate taxes, insurance, construction costs and other third-party expenses will also be paid by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company exercises an option to extend the Lease, rental payments during the applicable extension term will be 90% of the market rental rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company retained a national commercial real estate services firm to provide an appraisal of the initial market rental value of a portion of the property, which confirmed that the proposed initial rental rate per acre was consistent with market rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lease and appraisal were reviewed by a committee of disinterested members of the Companys Board of Directors and the Lease was approved by this committee and by the Companys Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the Code of Conduct, which applies to all of the Companys directors, officers and employees, conflicts of interest are prohibited unless approved by the Board of Directors or allowed under guidelines approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Code of Conduct, a conflict of interest can arise whenever a persons private interests interfere in any way with the interests of the Company, including when a director, officer or employee takes actions or has interests that make it difficult for such person to perform his or her work objectively and effectively, or when a director, officer or employee or a member of such persons family receives potentially improper personal benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the relationships described above has been reviewed and approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATIONSHIPS WITH AUDITORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2005, the Audit Committee approved the engagement of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm and has re-approved the engagement in each subsequent year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche LLP has performed audit services, including the issuance of their audit opinion for the fiscal years ended January 31, 2017, 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One or more representatives of Deloitte & Touche LLP will be present at the Annual Meeting, will have an opportunity to make a statement as he or she may desire and will be available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following report is not deemed to be soliciting material or to be filed with the SEC or subject to the SECs proxy rules or the liabilities of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), and the report shall not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any prior or subsequent filing by the Company under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During Fiscal 2017, the Audit Committee was composed of three independent directors of the Company (as independence is defined under NASDAQs Marketplace Rules and the rules and regulations of the SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors has determined that during Fiscal 2017, all three current members of the Audit Committee, Joel S. Lawson III, Edward N. Antoian, and Scott A. Belair, qualified as audit committee financial experts as defined by the SEC in Item 407(d)(5)(ii) of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its purpose is to monitor the integrity of the financial statements, review the Companys internal accounting procedures and controls, oversee the independence, qualification and performance of the Companys independent accountants and appoint the independent accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including the system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Audit Committee reviewed the audited financial statements in the Annual Report on Form 10-K for Fiscal 2017 with management, including a discussion of the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviewed with the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, Deloitte & Touche LLP, who is responsible for expressing an opinion on the conformity of the Companys audited financial statements with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles, its judgments as to the quality, not just the acceptability, of the Companys accounting principles and discussed with the independent accountants such other matters as are required under Auditing Standard No. 1301 and other generally accepted auditing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has discussed with the independent accountants the accountants independence from management and the Company, including the matters in the written disclosures and the letter received by the Audit Committee, as required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board and considered the compatibility of nonaudit services with the accountants independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with the Companys independent accountants the overall scope and plans for the audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met with the independent accountants, with and without management present, to discuss the results of their examination, their evaluation of the Companys internal controls and the overall quality of the Companys financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for Fiscal 2017 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joel S. Lawson III, Chairman of the Audit Committee Edward N. Antoian Scott A. Belair

sentences.text: Audit and Permissible Non-Audit Services Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has a pre-approval policy pursuant to which it has granted its approval for Deloitte & Touche, as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, to perform certain audit, audit-related, tax and other services up to specified aggregate fee levels for each service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically reviews and revises, if necessary, the list of pre-approved services that Deloitte & Touche may provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees policy also provides that any proposed services that are not specifically pre-approved pursuant to the policy, as well as any proposed services that exceed pre-approved cost levels established in the policy, will require the Audit Committees separate pre-approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee may delegate pre-approval authority to one or more of its members, who must report, for information purposes only, any pre-approval decisions to the Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee pre-approved all audit, audit-related and tax services provided by Deloitte & Touche during Fiscal 2017 in accordance with this policy.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires the Companys officers and directors, and persons who own more than ten percent of a registered class of the Companys equity securities (10% Shareholders) to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers, directors and 10% Shareholders are required to furnish the Company with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely on the Companys review of the copies of such forms received by it and a written representation from certain reporting persons that no Forms 5 were required for those persons, the Company believes that, during Fiscal 2017, all filing requirements applicable to its officers, directors and 10% Shareholders under Section 16(a) were complied with on a timely basis, except that one Form 4 reporting a stock option grant was not timely filed by Mr. Galloway.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares continuously for at least three years, to include in the Companys proxy materials for an annual meeting of shareholders a number of director nominees up to the greater of two or 25% of the Board of Directors, provided that the shareholder(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 1.10 of the By-laws, written notice of shareholder nominations to the Board of Directors that are to be included in the Proxy Statement must be delivered to the Secretary of the Company not later than 120 nor earlier than 150 days prior to the first anniversary of the preceding years annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
